result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas Patrick Reams

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Nicholas Patrick Reams in court.  Attorney Michael M. Hayes in court for Nicholas Patrick Reams.  Prosecuting attorney Tyler James Rubenzer in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for deferred prosecution agreement hearing.
State informed the Court that they are waiting on approval of the DPA and request additional time. Court grants request.
Case is adjourned for Deferred Prosecution Agreement Hearing in Branch 13.
Parties are advised that effective 10/31/2022, pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-17, this case will be reassigned to Branch 37, Judge Dee in Room 515 of the Courthouse.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Nicholas Patrick Reams in court.  Attorney Michael M. Hayes in court for Nicholas Patrick Reams.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. Parties are pursuing a DPA resolution. Case is adjourned in Branch 13.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.
No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Nicholas Patrick Reams in court. Attorney Michael M. Hayes in court for Nicholas Patrick Reams.  Prosecuting attorney Jack T Eichorst in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 13.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 13.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defense counsel contacted the court and requested an adjournment for 9/9 hearing. Court grants request. Parties notified of new date.
Motion to Reschedule, received and filed.
